legalCapacity.title: Legal Capacity
legalCapacity.description: Cannot sign any official contract. All actions require guardian approval.
legalCapacity.details: A minor under 15 years cannot sign any official contract. All legal actions require approval from a guardian or custodian.

economicRights.title: Economic Rights
economicRights.description: No personal bank account. No right to manage money except through a guardian.
economicRights.details: A girl at this age cannot open a bank account or manage her finances independently.

civilRights.title: Civil Rights
civilRights.description: No passport without both parents' approval. No travel without a male guardian.
civilRights.details: A passport cannot be issued for a minor without both parents' approval. Travel requires accompaniment by a male guardian.

marriage.title: Marriage (The Great Paradox)
marriage.description: Reality: Religious marriage - contract before a cleric (not officially registered)
marriage.details: Lives in a 'legal shadow' without rights, late registration upon pregnancy or childbirth, 'An elementary school child becomes a 'wife' by societal norms!'

legalCapacity.title: Legal Capacity
legalCapacity.description: Signing contracts requires guardian approval and judicial supervision. Juvenile court is the protector.
legalCapacity.details: A girl can sign some contracts with guardian approval and under judicial supervision from juvenile court.

economicRights.title: Economic Rights
economicRights.description: Savings account under guardian supervision. Cannot withdraw money freely.
economicRights.details: Can open a savings account under guardian supervision, but cannot withdraw or manage funds freely.

civilRights.title: Civil Rights
civilRights.description: No passport without both parents' approval. No travel without a male guardian.
civilRights.details: A passport cannot be issued for a minor without both parents' approval. Travel requires accompaniment by a male guardian.

marriage.title: Marriage (The Great Paradox)
marriage.description: "The judge may authorize marriage for those who have completed fifteen years if necessary..."
marriage.details: The problem: Guardian consent may be coercive, and 'necessity' is interpreted loosely.

economicRights.title: Economic Rights
economicRights.description: Own, sell, and buy with complete freedom.
economicRights.details: Complete freedom of ownership and financial management without restrictions.

civilRights.title: Civil Rights
civilRights.description: Freedom to travel and obtain documents.
civilRights.details: Freedom to travel and obtain passport and documents independently.

marriage.title: Marriage
marriage.description: Can marry without anyone's permission. Her personal decision is the law.
marriage.details: Freedom to marry with her personal consent without needing permission from any other party.
